weights.label: Prime Impact (RAPM/BPM blend)
weights.description: How far a player's best five-year stretch pushes team performance above era-adjusted expectation.

weights.label: Stage Dominance
weights.description: Trophies, Finals equity, and shot creation against top-10 postseason defenses.

weights.label: Longevity & Availability
weights.description: All-NBA seasons, durable minutes, and value above replacement over 15+ years.

weights.label: Versatility & Scalability
weights.description: Lineup flexibility, two-way adaptability, and proof of concept across different roster archetypes.

weights.label: Cultural Capital
weights.description: Awards, innovations, and imprint on the sport's global storytelling.

players.name: LeBron James
players.resume: All-time playoff minutes leader with 4 titles and 19 All-NBA nods.

players.name: Michael Jordan
players.resume: Six-for-six in the Finals with the highest single-season scoring impact index on record.

players.name: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar
players.resume: Six MVP awards, six titles, and 20 seasons anchoring top-five offenses.

players.name: Tim Duncan
players.resume: 19 straight winning seasons and the best defensive RAPM decade of the modern era.

players.name: Magic Johnson
players.resume: Five titles and the highest offensive box creation mark for a primary initiator.

players.name: Bill Russell
players.resume: Eleven titles powered by era-best defensive stop rates and leadership metrics.

players.name: Stephen Curry
players.resume: Four titles, two MVPs, and unrivaled spacing gravity that rewired offensive geometry.

players.name: Shaquille O'Neal
players.resume: Peak true shooting plus 3 straight Finals MVPs built a dynasty-level apex.

players.name: Nikola Jokic
players.resume: Three MVPs in four years with all-time offensive EPM runs and a 2023 title.

players.name: Larry Bird
players.resume: Three straight MVPs and the league's most efficient wing-driven offenses of the 1980s.

players.name: Wilt Chamberlain
players.resume: Volume records galore with elite durability, tempered by playoff translation gaps.

players.name: Kevin Durant
players.resume: Scoring champion in four eras with scalable plug-and-play gravity.

players.name: Kobe Bryant
players.resume: Five championships and unparalleled shot-making difficulty, with long-term durability.

players.name: Hakeem Olajuwon
players.resume: Back-to-back titles, all-time rim protection metrics, and versatile post play.

players.name: Giannis Antetokounmpo
players.resume: Two MVPs, a DPOY, and a 50-point Finals closeout before turning 30.

rising.name: Nikola Jokic
rising.signal: Three MVPs in four years with historic offensive efficiency streaks.

rising.name: Giannis Antetokounmpo
rising.signal: Entering age-30 season with peak two-way metrics still trending up.

rising.name: Luka Doncic
rising.signal: 2024 postseason heroics pushed his impact curve into Pantheon territory.

rising.name: Anthony Edwards
rising.signal: USA Basketball takeover plus elite wing defense improved scalability marks.

rising.name: A'ja Wilson (WNBA cross-index)
rising.signal: Her impact metrics contextualize the women's game for future blended GOAT revisions.
